body_html:
It's not clear to me that this would make more sense - especially for the base use case where users simply have some IDs (without weights). Considering how the tensorflow.Example input data is probably storing the IDs as a repeated bytes_list or int64_list and how the weights are usually stored as a parallel Feature, it seems this change would force users to do an additional conversion into this matrix format.

Also, given existing uses of this externally and internally, I'm not sure it's worth the API churn.

Thoughts, @ysuematsu ?

body:
It's not clear to me that this would make more sense - especially for the base use case where users simply have some IDs (without weights). Considering how the `tensorflow.Example` input data is probably storing the IDs as a repeated `bytes_list` or `int64_list` and how the weights are usually stored as a parallel `Feature`, it seems this change would force users to do an additional conversion into this matrix format.

Also, given existing uses of this externally and internally, I'm not sure it's worth the API churn.

Thoughts, @ysuematsu ?
